subject: Re: [junit] test method with arguments?
msgSnippet: ... Extract testVariousParams() into the suite() method and you have the beginnings of the Parameterized Test Case pattern. The above is exactly how I used to
messageBody:
Andrew McDonagh wrote:
>
> I use the following pattern...
>
>
> public void testVariousParams() {
> paramTest("a param";
> paramTest("second test param");
> ....
> }
>
> private void paramTest(String expectedValue) {
> Something something = new Something();
> assertEquals("didn't work", expectedvalue, something.getValue());
> }
>
>
> The only issue is that the private test case methods cannot be named
> test**** as the JUnit framework moans about them being private or having
> params.

Extract testVariousParams() into the suite() method and you have the
beginnings of the Parameterized Test Case pattern. The above is exactly
how I used to do it.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
